intro: Stylogyne leptantha, commonly known as the slender-stemmed stylogyne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central column. Stylogyne leptantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
